Paragraph1: The Chariot represents ambition, humbleness and willpower. It stands for the drive to succeed and quiet confidence in one’s abilities.
Paragraph2: You should seek new opportunities, take stock of your situation and trust that you are up to the challenge.
Paragraph3: For Evelyn, The Chariot is a cascading river - it can carry you far but will be hard to swim against.

Paragraph1: The Chariot represents ambition, humbleness and willpower. It stands for the drive to succeed and quiet confidence in one’s abilities.
Paragraph2: You should seek new opportunities, take stock of your situation and trust that you are up to the challenge.
Paragraph3: Madame Sosoteris sees The Chariot as a gently meandering river, it is your choice whether to paddle or float.

Paragraph1: The Chariot represents ambition, humbleness and willpower. It stands for the drive to succeed and quiet confidence in one’s abilities.
Paragraph2: You should seek new opportunities, take stock of your situation and trust that you are up to the challenge.
Paragraph3: Maledictus trusts The Chariot’s wheels, but a bit of oil never goes amiss.

Paragraph1: Death stands for transformation, transition or change; the certainty of ending and the possibility of rebirth.
Paragraph2: You should be open to new opportunities, appreciate the present before it becomes the past and take time for self-improvement.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees Death as an unfamiliar figure bringing strange gifts.

Paragraph1: Death stands for transformation, transition or change; the certainty of ending and the possibility of rebirth.
Paragraph2: You should be open to new opportunities, appreciate the present before it becomes the past and take time for self-improvement.
Paragraph3: Madame Sosoteris sees Death as a changing of the tides.

Paragraph3: Maledictus sees Death as an old friend.

Paragraph1: The Devil represents temptation, attachment or darkness; the lure of desire and the constraint of weakness.
Paragraph2: You should acknowledge your guilty pleasures, reflect on any negative tendencies and be wary of instant gratification.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees the Devil as symbolic of obsession.

Paragraph1: The Emperor represents structure, authority and strength. He is a symbol of decisiveness and the judicious use of reason.
Paragraph2: You should listen to an authority figure or try to understand someone’s position. Don’t be afraid to make difficult choices.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees the Emperor as someone giving you recognition or reward, what might you do to deserve it?

Paragraph3: Madame Sosoteris sees The Emperor as a symbol of leadership and influence.

Paragraph1: The Empress represents abundance, nature or beauty; the rich creativity of expression and the joy of cooking or eating.
Paragraph2: You should explore your artistic side, revel in your friendships and look for the beautiful concealed as the everyday.
Paragraph3: Evelyn advises you to walk with The Empress down the paths of the forest, and to pick fruit from the trees at its heart.

Paragraph1: The Fool represents innocence, optimism, and freedom; new beginnings and adventures to come.
Paragraph2: You should approach opportunities with an open mind, see the world through childlike eyes and find excitement in disruption.
Paragraph3: Evelyn suggests you look closer - what distant possibilities lie off in the distance or hidden in the details? Where might The Fool be leading you?

Paragraph1: The Hanged Man represents observation, pause for thought or surrender; a chance for a new perspective and a reminder to be flexible.
Paragraph2: You should think about taking a break, remember that sunk costs cannot be recovered and consider the world from a new angle.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Hanged Man as a reminder to reconnect with the natural world.

Paragraph2: You should think about taking a break, remember that sunk costs cannot be recovered and consider the world from a new angle.

Paragraph2: You should think about taking a break, remember that sunk costs cannot be recovered and consider the world from a new angle.

Paragraph1: The Hermit represents introspection, inner guidance and solitude; the contemplative benefit of silence and the refreshing relief of nature.
Paragraph2: You should focus your energies inwards, look to get out of the house or city and make the most of any thinking time.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Hermit as encouraging you to take a break, you will soon feel the benefits.

Paragraph3: Madame Sosoteris believes The Hermit stands for something deep within, what might be below the surface of your thoughts?

Paragraph1: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom, conformity and tradition; solemn commitment and resistance to change.
Paragraph2: You should think carefully before making decisions, listen to the advice of those you respect and remember to keep your promises.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Hierophant as a symbol of continuity, can you divine what she means by that?

Paragraph3: Madame Sosoteris believes you should revisit past hobbies or friendships, sometimes renewal is better than beginning.

Paragraph1: Judgement represents absolution, rebirth or a decision; a change in attitude or the certainty of fate.
Paragraph2: You should trust in your own faculties, be prepared to share your story with others and listen to your heart before your head.
Paragraph3: Evelyn believes that Judgement stands for a decision you are mulling over, does her card hold any further clues?

Paragraph2: You should trust in your own faculties, be prepared to share your story with others and listen to your heart before your head.
Paragraph3: Madame Sosoteris sees Judgement as forgiveness, what might need letting go?

Paragraph1: Justice represents fairness, balance and reason; the authoritative guidance of law and equanimity in the face of misfortune.
Paragraph2: You should be ready to answer questions, seek out opportunities for feedback and remember to be even-handed.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees Justice as representing a teacher or law-giver.

Paragraph1: The Lovers represents relationships, choices and harmony; the blissful unity of love and the first kindling of attraction.
Paragraph2: You should look to strengthen your closest bonds, follow opportunities for romance and strive for passion in all things.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Lovers as representing the whirl of romance, look for chances to show someone you love them.

Paragraph1: The Magician represents power, wisdom, and resourcefulness; the capacity for creation and the thread between dream and action.
Paragraph2: You should follow your instincts, take a chance or begin a new venture. Believe in yourself and commit.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Magician as a source of power, what could he represent?

Paragraph1: The Moon represents the subconscious, intuition and illusion; the illumination of anxiety or the mysteries revealed by moonlight.
Paragraph2: You should think about the nuances of your situation, watch carefully for deceit and listen to your breath.
Paragraph3: Evelyn believes that moonlight transforms the world into magic, your best ideas will come at the close of the day.

Paragraph1: The High Priestess represents intuition, the subconscious, or spiritual awakening. She is the gatekeeper of sacred wisdom and divine femininity.
Paragraph2: You should pay attention to your dreams, listen to your closest friends and seek knowledge in unusual places.
Paragraph3: Evelyn believes that wisdom lies close at hand. What do you see in the High Priestess or what might she represent?

Paragraph1: The Star represents hope, renewal and spirituality; the calming relief of faith or the glimmer of distant optimism.
Paragraph2: You should trust in the direction of your journey, take time to pay attention to the details and look for things to get excited by.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Star as the glow of possibility, you already know what motivates you.

Paragraph1: Strength stands for courage, compassion and influence; the strength to stand up for what’s right and the confidence to admit your mistakes.
Paragraph2: You should be brave when going outside your comfort zone, try to persuade people to your point of view and be unwavering in the face of injustice.
Paragraph3: Evelyn says that Strength does not always mean power, the heart is also a muscle.

Paragraph1: The Sun represents positivity, warmth or success. It smiles upon your ventures and your soul.
Paragraph2: You should feel confident in yourself, look on the future with optimism and remember to be kind to others.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Sun as a symbol of contentment, joy need not always come from excitement.

Paragraph1: The Wheel of Fortune represents luck, destiny or unpredictability; the chaotic pattern of existence or the happy accident of good fortune.
Paragraph2: You should embrace the unexpected, risk trying new things and remember that you cannot control every detail.
Paragraph3: Evelyn sees The Wheel of Fortune as the promise of fate, you will end up where you’re meant to be.

Paragraph1: The world represents achievement, accomplishment and travel; the promise of discovery and the satisfaction of completion.
Paragraph2: You should take a moment to be proud of your success, remember to take stock of things that make you happy and finish any passion projects.
